options.optionText: Wow, Diana. Busy day? Or just another Tuesday?
options.responseText: Honey, if it were just another Tuesday, I wouldn’t still be covered in all this... ‘appreciation’. Guess I really left an impression, huh?

followUpOptions.optionText: Yeah, you’re really dripping in success...
followUpOptions.responseText: Oh, I don’t mind a little mess. Think of it as proof of my... *productivity*. Some girls collect stamps. I collect control.

followUpOptions.optionText: You’re practically a charity worker at this point.
followUpOptions.responseText: Charity? Please. This is *strategic*. Keep the tension up, give them a taste, and watch them squirm. I’m basically running this vault by now.

followUpOptions.optionText: Ever consider charging a fee? You could corner the market.
followUpOptions.responseText: You think anyone here could afford me? I run this place on supply and *demand*. And trust me, the demand is real high.

followUpOptions.optionText: So, should I bring you a mop or a medal?
followUpOptions.responseText: Neither. I’m more into... hands-on recognition, if you catch my drift. The vault’s tension is up, and so are they.

followUpOptions.optionText: Hands-on? Guess those guys know that *firsthand* now.
followUpOptions.responseText: Exactly. And believe me, they’ll be coming back for more. Nobody handles pressure like I do.

followUpOptions.optionText: Gonna need more than two hands at this rate.
followUpOptions.responseText: Two? Honey, you underestimate me. I’ve got a vault full of needy men, and I’m handling all of them just fine.

options.optionText: I’m not sure what I just walked in on, but... good job, I guess?
options.responseText: You walked in on the future of this vault, honey. And you’re welcome to join the winning team. If you can keep up, that is.
Leaving already? Don’t worry, they’ll be back soon enough. And when they do, I’ll be ready for another round.
